description: A hearty, nutritious, and comforting one-pot dish where rice and beans are cooked together with aromatic spices, creating a complete protein and a staple meal found in households across Uganda.

cultural_significance.cultural_notes: Rice and Beans is a fundamental, no-fuss meal that provides affordable and complete nutrition. It's a common dish for students, busy families, and anyone needing a quick, filling meal. While simple, it's a canvas for flavor and can be found in various forms, from plain and simple to richly spiced, in homes and local eateries (canteens) all over the country.

ingredients.name: Dried Beans (Red Kidney or Pinto)
ingredients.notes: Soaked overnight, or for at least 8 hours

steps.instruction: Drain and rinse the beans that were soaked overnight.
In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger. Sauté for another minute until fragrant.
Add the chopped tomatoes and curry powder. Cook for 5-7 minutes, mashing the tomatoes with the spoon, until they break down and form a thick sauce.
Add the drained beans to the pot and stir to coat them in the tomato mixture.
Pour in the 5 cups of water. Add the salt and the optional stock cube and whole chili pepper. Bring to a boil.
Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for 30 minutes. This allows the beans to start becoming tender.

cooking_indicators.visual: Beans will begin to soften but will not be fully cooked.

steps.instruction: Add the washed rice to the pot with the partially cooked beans. Stir gently to combine.
Bring the mixture back to a gentle simmer. Then, reduce the heat to the lowest setting, cover the pot tightly, and let it cook for 20-25 minutes. Do not open the lid during this time.

cooking_indicators.visual: The rice will be fluffy and have absorbed the liquid.
cooking_indicators.texture: Both rice and beans should be tender.

steps.instruction: After 25 minutes, turn off the heat and let the pot sit, covered, for another 10 minutes to steam fully.
Remove the lid and fluff the rice and beans with a fork. Remove the whole chili pepper if used.
Serve the rice and beans hot.

serving_suggestions: Serve as a complete meal on its own, or with a side of avocado, a simple tomato and onion salad (Kachumbari), or steamed greens like Sukuma Wiki. A dollop of plain yogurt also pairs well.
